page.title: 04Manor Farm, Dalderby
page.content: The farmhouse is 300 years old and has been in the same family for 100 years. They have 450 acres of land and grow sugar beet, potatoes, winter wheat, summer barley, winter barley and carrots.The farm has many cows and sheep which graze on the grassland. In Dalderby there is no letterbox or telphone kiosk, but there is a very interesting war memorial, erected on 25th September in 1938 for sending the greatest percentage of men from a village in England. There are no shops in Dalderby. Stonehill farm is quite old. The farm's main products are cereals and sugar beet, farmed over 600 acres. There are no fields of pasture and no animals. The farm workers have lived in the bungalow at Stone Hill farm for 5 years.
